ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn tà pi ne ńzába ntʉ́m na Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto wege gẅie à gẅiin máamáa legúʼ, ńgíŋe ńgẅiin tyɛ̀ʼte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: My brothers and sisters, do not show favoritism as you hold on to the faith in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Pege gɔɔn ngie pʉ̀a mépʉ́a kǔ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá cúʼtè gí, tàʼ nyìŋ jÿɔ́gɔ kwáŋ gẅie à cÿɔ́g nkáb, ḿmaʼ menzsǒ nkáb. Wetsɔ̌ maʼ yé pɔ́ metsyàg nzsǒ.
en: For if someone comes into your meeting wearing a gold ring and dressed in fine clothes, and a poor person dressed in filthy clothes also comes in,

ngiemboon: Pi tÿɔ́g menÿɔ́g na nyìŋ gẅie à maʼ menzsǒ nkáb, nyìŋ gẅi gɔɔn né ye ngie à jʉʼʉ melÿò yɔɔn, mbà! «Tóo ńnéŋe jʉʼɔɔn!» Ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn né fÿɔg ngie: «Gyá jʉʼ ńtyé wó.» Ńké te púʼu wɔ́ «Ɔ̀ tó ńtém ntsẅɛ̀ʼ jù ssé, á ngʉ̀ŋe mmó gie n tÿɔ́g mekwò mɔ́ɔn mǒ lɔɔn.»
en: if you look with favor on the one wearing the fine clothes and say, “Sit here in a good place,” and yet you say to the poor person, “Stand over there,” or “Sit here on the floor by my footstool,”

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo púʼu, pi lěen ńdɔgɔ ńgẅiin tyɛ̀ʼte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́ɔ? Pi lěen ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ nkwaŋá tepòŋ ńdíe pʉ̀a éfaʼa pì wɔ́ɔ?
en: haven’t you made distinctions among yourselves and become judges with evil thoughts?

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn petʉ̀nzẅìŋ, pi júʼ mboŋó, e Ssé la tsɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a pie mé tóŋo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó lê mefÿɔg, ńdɔg ńgÿo pazáb ntʉ́m na ye tɛʼ, pɔ́ gẅiin yɔ́b jʉʼ tsɛ̀ɛ nò lefùɔ sie à la kaʼa mbwó pʉ̀a pie é kwoŋo yé.
en: Listen, my dear brothers and sisters: Didn’t God choose the poor in this world   to be rich in faith  # 2:5 Lk 12:21; Rv 2:9 and heirs  # 2:5 Rm 4:13–14; 8:17; Gl 3:29; 4:7; Ti 3:7; Heb 1:2; 11:7 of the kingdom that he has promised to those who love him?

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa na pi, mbà pi kéen ńcʉŋ nzẅìŋ mefÿɔg. Tá megàŋa mmó zɔ̌ téen sẅɛ́ɛ gẅí wɔ́ le? Pɔ́ zɔ̌ téen ńgwá ńdɔgɔ gẅí, ńgiŋe mendátsǎŋ wɔ́ le?
en: Yet you have dishonored the poor.   Don’t the rich oppress you and drag  # 2:6 Ac 8:3; 17:6; 18:12 you into court?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɔ̌ téen shwóŋo tepòŋ na Yěsô Keleto gẅie Ssé la ná lezíŋ sé né pi wɔ́ le?
en: Don’t they blaspheme the good name that was invoked over you?

ngiemboon: Á cʉ́ʼ gie pi gÿo púʼu, pi giŋe na páʼ lepʉ̌ selÿò na nò lefùɔ Ssé gɔɔn, é gɔɔn ngie: «Kwoŋo fɛ̌ gù nyìŋ mesoŋ páʼ ɔ̀ kwoŋo twó mbùm jú.» Pi lɔgɔ púʼu, ńgÿo mboŋó.
en: Indeed, if you fulfill the royal law prescribed in the Scripture, Love your neighbor as yourself,  ,# 2:8 Lv 19:18; Mt 22:39 you are doing well.

ngiemboon: Tá pi ké ńgẅiin tyɛ̀ʼte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbà pi gÿǒ nò tepòŋ. Lepʉ̌ Ssé gwoon gẅí mélàʼmie pi fʉ̌a lepʉ̌.
en: If, however, you show favoritism,   you commit sin and are convicted by the law as transgressors.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńkúʼte mbʉ̌ Ssé, ńgʉa mǒ fʉa pɔ́ ndàʼ tàʼ, mbà à pǔ fʉa pɔ́ mbʉ̌ ntsèm.
en: For whoever keeps the entire law, and yet stumbles at one point, is guilty of breaking it all.

ngiemboon: Púʼu, ntí nue e Ssé gie e la gɔɔn ngie: «Te gÿo gÿɛ́,» e la gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Te zẅé nyìŋ.» Tá ńgwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ lɔɔn te gÿɛ́ gÿo, ḿbiŋ ńzẅé nyìŋ, mbà ɔ̀ fʉ̌a lepʉ̌ sé fʉa.
en: For he who said, Do not commit adultery,   also said, Do not murder.   # 2:11 Ex 20:13; Dt 5:17,# 2:11 Ex 20:13–14; Dt 5:17–18 So if you do not commit adultery, but you murder, you are a lawbreaker.

ngiemboon: Pi gwaa ne gɔɔn nò, ńne ńgÿo páʼ pʉ̀a pie mé ge láʼ lɔg lepʉ̌ sie é gÿo mé cʉ́ʼʉ pandùnnɛ́ e lɔg ŋaga wɔ́b.
en: Speak and act as those who are to be judged by the law of freedom.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ge láʼ ne tsɔ́ʼte mentsaŋ, á le tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe te tsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a wɔ́, tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ la tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe, mbà Ssé ge láʼ lɔg púʼu, á le yé ŋag.
en: For judgment is without mercy to the one who has not shown mercy.   Mercy triumphs over judgment.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, nyìŋ lɔɔn ngie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé na Ssé, à te faʼ mefàʼ ńdɔg ńnyɛ wɔ́, mbà á ge kẅéte na kɔ́? Tà ńgwɔ́ yɛ̌ ntí lézáb ntʉ́m na Ssé, é gÿo nyìŋ tsẅɛ́?
en: What good is it, my brothers and sisters, if someone claims to have faith but does not have works? Can such faith save him?

ngiemboon: Pege gɔɔn ngie tsɔ̌ fɛ̌ wege wembàŋa mbɔɔ wemanzwě, pɔ́ té nzsǒ maʼ, ḿbiŋ ńne ńzága mmó gie pɔ́ ge pfɛ́ɛ na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ,
en: If a brother or sister is without clothes and lacks daily food

ngiemboon: atsɔ̌ nyìŋ na pi piŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi lo né kwò gí yembòŋo, mbùm gí lumte. Pi pfɛ́ ńzẅɛ́, ńgɔɔn púʼu, ńké te náa tsɔ́ mmó gie á ge kẅéte wɔ́b wɔ́,» mbà wɛ̌ légɔɔn ge kẅéte na kɔ́?
en: and one of you says to them, “Go in peace, stay warm, and be well fed,” but you don’t give them what the body needs, what good is it?

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ púʼu, na nyìŋ gẅie à ne ngie à záb ntʉ́m wé na Ssé, páʼ mé lɔɔn te ne ńgyá mefàʼ mé wɔ́, mbà wɛ̌ lézáb ntʉ́m na Ssé aa sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: In the same way faith, if it does not have works, is dead by itself.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̀ʼ ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gɔɔn ngie: «Aye tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ lézáb ntʉ́m wé na Ssé, aye wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ pɔ́ léfaʼ mefàʼ.» Mbà n ge gɔɔn yɔ́ɔn mbwó yé ngie: Nyɛɛ wɔ́ɔn páʼ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́, ɔ̀ záb ntʉ́m na Ssé té ne faʼa mefàʼ, n dɔg mefàʼ mɔ́ɔn ńnyɛɛ gú ngie n záb ntʉ́m na Ssé.
en: But someone will say, “You have faith, and I have works.”   Show me your faith without works, and I will show you faith by my works.  # 2:18 Rm 3:28; Heb 11:33; Jms 3:13

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ne ńzẅíŋe ngie e Ssé, ee yémɔʼɔ́, oon áa mbòŋ, messé tepòŋ gíŋe ńne ńzẅíŋe yɔ́b pɔ́ púʼu, tá ḿbiŋe ńne ḿvɛɛ.
en: You believe that God is one. Good! Even the demons believe #— #and they shudder.

ngiemboon: Agʉ̀gʉ̀ yɔ́ɔn, ɔ̀ kwoŋo kɔ́? N ge nyɛɛ gú ngie lezǎb ntʉ́m na Ssé gẅie à te mefàʼ gẅiin áa sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: Senseless person! Are you willing to learn that faith without works is useless?

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gwaa gɔɔn ngie tá wege Ábalaham aa ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò yé, ńné ńgɔɔn ngie á cʉa pɔ́ na mefàʼ mé? Á la te cʉa pɔ́ na páʼ à lɔgɔ́ míŋ we Ésàg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ á jʉʼ gie mé nuŋe pwɔʼ wó wɔ́ le?
en: Wasn’t Abraham our father justified by works in offering Isaac his son on the altar?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgyá ngie we lézáb ntʉ́m na Ssé pâ mefàʼ mé la púte ńgiŋe kwò. Á la fó na mefàʼ mé we lézáb ntʉ́m na Ssé gwɔ́ wó tà ńkuʼ.
en: You see that faith was active together with his works, and by works, faith was made complete,

ngiemboon: Anò gie mé la ŋweʼe ńtí yé, á fó púʼu ḿbumte, mé la ŋweʼe ngie: «Ábalaham la záb ntʉ́m wé na Ssé, e Ssé fó mǒ, ńcʉ́ʼ ńdíe yé, á gwɔ́ mvfò ye, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ.» Á tóŋo yé lê shǔ we.
en: and the Scripture was fulfilled that says, Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness,  ,# 2:23 Gn 15:6; Rm 4:3; Gl 3:6 and he was called God’s friend.  # 2:23 2Ch 20:7; Is 41:8

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ ńgyá ngie á cʉa pɔ́ na mefàʼ mie nyìŋ ne faʼa, tá Ssé gɔɔn ngie ngàŋ aa ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò yé, tà é té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndàʼ páʼ ngàŋ zǎb ntʉ́m wé na Ssé wɔ́.
en: You see that a person is justified by works and not by faith alone.

ngiemboon: Á la gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu, na Lahab, káatÿǒ manzwě, e Ssé la gwaa gɔɔn ngie aa ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò yé, ńcʉa pɔ́ na mefàʼ mé. Páʼ à la náa jʉʼʉ lelyěen mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ pie mé la túm, ḿbiŋ ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b nzsè gie pɔ́ ge pfó mǒ é gʉa.
en: In the same way, wasn’t Rahab the prostitute also justified by works in receiving the messengers and sending them out by a different route?

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ mbùm nnɛ́ gie e te zẅìge gẅiin, ee ye nkwě la, lezǎb ntʉ́m na Ssé gẅie mé té mefàʼ mé gyá, à giŋé ńgwɔ́ yé we nkwě.
en: For just as the body without the spirit is dead, so also faith without works is dead.
